snippet: Since cetaceans are so smart, we should ask if they want to serve.
abstract: Op-Ed article by Prof Philip Hoare examines the ethics of using dolphins and other cetaceans in military operations, practice that began in the United States in the 1960s; notes while concept might be off-putting, dolphins themselves have their own violent tendencies, and have proved their usefulness in a military setting; questions, however, whether dolphins, as moral beings, might object to being weapons of war.
lead_paragraph: Since cetaceans are so smart, we should ask if they want to serve.

headline.main: Let Slip the Dolphins of War
headline.print_headline: Let Slip the Dolphins of War

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject
